description.narrative:
The proposed research aims at examining and understanding collaboration mechanisms taking place between local authorities and humanitarian actors in addressing the Syrian Refugee Crisis in urban settings of Lebanon. In so doing, the proposed research seeks to recommend and inform urban responses in Lebanon and potentially other, international settings to which recommendations could be adapted.
To target the populations that will directly benefit from the project, the Research Team has taken a number of measures. At the most basic level, the study is focusing on two areas (Bourj Hammoud and the Union of Municipalities of Sahel Zahrani in Saida) that each host a large refugee population, especially when considered relative to their local, host-community populations. Moreover, one is an urban suburb and the other peri-urban; the former an area excluded from the programming of Municipalities and aid organizations and the later an exemplary case of the involvement of Unions of Municipalities in coordinating with and among aid organizations. To engage the community at hand, interviews with key officials and stakeholders of local, national, and international organizations and authorities will take place as well as focus groups with the targeted Syrian refugee and Lebanese host communities. In so doing, the proposed research will be able to specifically target communities and community needs of those which it is focusing on.
